TextView.android:text: Stick to a Sleep Schedule: Aim for 7-8 hours of sleep, going to bed and waking up at the same time every day. If you can't fall asleep in 20 minutes, leave the bedroom and engage in a relaxing activity until you're tired. Watch Your Diet: Avoid heavy meals close to bedtime, and limit nicotine, caffeine, and alcohol, as they can disrupt sleep. Create a Restful Environment: Keep your bedroom cool, dark, and quiet, and limit light exposure before bed. Consider calming activities like a warm bath to help you wind down. Limit Daytime Naps: Keep naps short (under an hour) and avoid napping late in the day, unless necessary due to your work schedule. Exercise Regularly: Physical activity promotes better sleep, but avoid exercising too close to bedtime. Manage Worries: Resolve concerns before bed, and use stress management techniques like journaling, organization, or meditation to ease anxiety. These habits can help improve sleep quality despite external stressors or disruptions.
